author: johnny elkins
comment: Well he still would not have gotten into UA some other hero school maybe but unless you have a quirk no matter how physically strong or fit you are you can not get into UA or stay in it. He could have been the worlds first quirkless Hero for sure in that universe as Batman proves that all you really need is just to be smart in order to be a Hero as Batman in his world is one of the most feared and respected Heroes to face. Like the guy that could see into the future of a person his quark alone is great but kinda lacking compared to others but he is also physically really strong. Like Mirio proved that even without his quirk to phase through stuff that he was some fearsome hero to deal with as he was physically really strong and smart he could have stayed a Hero but would have had to do things differently however a Hero world is a Quirk world they would not allow a quirkless person to be a Hero even if they were capable and proved themselves they would have probably been treated like a villain for acting as a Hero without a licence which pretty much you can only get if you have a quirk and go to a school that only accepts people who has quirks to train and become a Hero.  Basically if he had still been Quirkless the best bet of him being a Hero would be him becoming a vigilante that operated without a licence and in his world if that was found out then he would be treated as a villain even though he is trying to help not cause harm

author: Kirito-Kun Nightcore
comment: well it depends, what kind of copyright issue did you get? are they just claiming the video? or are they blocking and removing it from youtube?  if they are just claiming it then its no problem everyone can still watch it - i also dont earn any money with any of my uploads   if they are blocking and removing it from youtube: there must be some issues with the anime in your amv, i usually try to avoid clips longer than 2-3sec and try to use as many cuts as possible, sometimes mirroring also helps, but not all of the time.   if the reason is really the song of you amv then i recommend changing the song, or adjusting the pitch to a still acceptable speed (i rather recommend using a different song thou)   i hope i could help you mate ;)

author: stoagy mahalo
comment: So.... For the last 230 some odd amvs I've watch as of the last 5 years. I can surmise bands in that time frame have been having difficulty figuring out how to sound hard and their lyrics where some figured out you don't need to fill it with paragraphs while some others try to put EVERYTHING in it out of fear of it being their ONLY hit. Probably why I stick with the 90s-2003/4 bands that really hit it home with unorthodox music that are precursors to the tainted versions we have now (I.E. mumble rap, screemo and remix dubsteppers) which I do hope to be proven wrong but so far EVERY bands' original composition has started with the same drum beat, the same lets do this to lets do that make them scream and shout to the infamous i hurt so bad it hurts so good or  I'm so different from the rest of you its not even funny bumps here and there which at least with the random bands out there that shout and scream about that icrecream that fell on the floor, its something I can see they're having fun with or even the modern take on disco which is starting to sound so much more fun than this lets get pumped music that's been redone TOO many times to the point this very band has ripped off Within Temptation, Evanessance, My Chemical Romance, Linking Park, (Even...) HIM, 3 doors down AND the famous 3 Days Grace (specifically their entire emo album from pain to animal I become [Refer to monster]) and a bunch of Korn and Slipknot/Slayer to toss in there as assurance I didn't miss the countless others. I won't say its stupid to what they did since one my favorite bands LITERALLY only do covers of their favorite band (Queen) and that one acapella fellow and so on, I just hope of those who see this think about that and maybe when you get a chance, I'd like to recommend to you just look up the Video Game Soundtracks that are out there, you'd be amazed of what those bands and artists are doing with music these days ( recently the ENTIRE DOOM OST) and maybe match it up with the anime out there when doing AMVs these days guys.

author: CD Warrior
comment: I still have a hard time believing that Deku pulled off that victory against Muscular without help. I mean looking at that fight he was in a corner the whole time and the adrenaline he had coursing through him removed his bodily limitations which is the only reason he won. Muscular couldn't do that cause no matter how much adrenaline he has he can't actually increase his mass and thus adrenaline has no effect on his quirk. I'd like to point out that while in that state Deku's strength exceeds All-Mights best. Unfortunately, he beats the ever living shit out of his body when he gets to this state. It was an ass-pull of a victory but it made sense. it's just hard to imagine overcoming the image of muscular's massive overbuff form right on top of you even with herculean strength. yeah the image I speak of is around 2:26
